description: From Latin detruncatus, past participle of detruncare (“to cut off”), from de + truncare (“to maim, shorten, cut off”). See truncate.

verbs.description: detruncate (third-person singular simple present detruncates, present participle detruncating, simple past and past participle detruncated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To shorten by cutting; to lop off.
